doc.str: A water or wastewater treatment system to reduce phosphorus or other pollutant concentrations in water or wastewater may include an optional primary treatment stage in fluid communication with a biological secondary treatment stage. The secondary treatment stage may, in turn, be fluidly connected with a tertiary treatment stage, which may include a chemical treatment portion for reducing phosphorus or other pollutants to desired levels. The precipitated phosphorus and other solids or sludge produced from the chemical treatment portion may be recycled upstream for reuse in the primary, secondary, and/or tertiary treatment stages. Such recycle may reduce the amount of added chemicals required in the tertiary treatment stage to phosphorus or other pollutants to desired amounts.

Crawford et al., "Membrane Bioreactors--A Designer's Perspective," Proceedings of the 29.sup.th WEAO Conference and Technical Symposium, Hamilton, Ontario, 2000. cited by other . | Lebeau et al., "Application of Immersed Membrane Microfiltration for NOM Removal," Paper presented at AWWA Annual Conference & Exhibition, Dallas, Texas, Jun. 21-25, 1998. cited by other. | Kayser et al., "Operational Results of the Wolfsburg Wastewater Treatment Plant," Wat. Sci. Tech., vol. 25, No. 4-5, pp. 203-209, (1992). cited by other .
